intro: Perityle incana, commonly known as the hairy perityle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Perityle incana is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
